[`Component`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component.md)

## Component class


**Signature:**

```typescript
export class Component 
```

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [`addChild(component)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/addChild.md) |  | Adds a child component, loading it if this component is loaded |
|  [`load()`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/load.md) |  | Load this component and its children |
|  [`onload()`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/onload.md) |  | Override this to load your component |
|  [`onunload()`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/onunload.md) |  | Override this to unload your component |
|  [`register(cb)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/register.md) |  | Registers a callback to be called when unloading |
|  [`registerDomEvent(el, type, callback, options)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/registerDomEvent.md) |  | Registers an DOM event to be detached when unloading |
|  [`registerDomEvent(el, type, callback, options)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/registerDomEvent_1.md) |  | Registers an DOM event to be detached when unloading |
|  [`registerDomEvent(el, type, callback, options)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/registerDomEvent_2.md) |  | Registers an DOM event to be detached when unloading |
|  [`registerEvent(eventRef)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/registerEvent.md) |  | Registers an event to be detached when unloading |
|  [`registerInterval(id)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/registerInterval.md) |  | Registers an interval (from setInterval) to be cancelled when unloading Use  instead of  to avoid TypeScript confusing between NodeJS vs Browser API |
|  [`removeChild(component)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/removeChild.md) |  | Removes a child component, unloading it |
|  [`unload()`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/unload.md) |  | Unload this component and its children |
